ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask
ygData.msgSnippet: That was me who posted it.  If you are the only person attacking the mob, then you SHOULD be the only one on its hate list.  So when camping the noble in Sol
ygData.messageBody:
That was me who posted it. If you are the only person attacking the mob,
then you SHOULD be the only one on its hate list. So when camping the noble
in Sol B, when we knew he (or the PH) was about to spawn, I would stand near
his spawn spot and everyone would move away. When he spawned, since I was
closest he would automatically attack me first. They don't always cast
charm right off the bat, but in my experience its usually always near the
beginning of the fight. When fighting evil eyes, I would pull instead of
the primary puller.

Galtin of E'ci

-----Original Message-----
From: JESSICA_WEBBER@... [mailto:JESSICA_WEBBER@...]
Sent: Friday, December 08, 2000 8:39 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Mask



Woohoo! Congrats!

Also, please excuse the dumb newbie question, but in the thread about mobs
that charm, someone said they put away their weapons and get the mob to
charm them first, figuring they're the least threatening potential pet in
their group. My question is, how do you get the mob to charm you rather
than someone else? Are you just punching away at it, waiting for it to try
the charm spell, before anyone else joins in? Do mobs that charm
consistently cast this at the start of battles?

Thanks
Evulia, bard of 13 songs, Tunare





"Shaun Hopps"
